properties.areaDesc: Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu; Manua
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 11:19PM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
An active monsoonal trough continues to impact regions along the
American Samoa coastal waters. Elevated winds, especially within
rain bands, is expected to produce gale force winds in the
region. Sustained winds up to 40 knots, with higher gusts, is
forecast through Monday.

Strong winds coupled with large storm surges can generate hazardous
waves which could capsize or damage vessels. Widespread showers,
heavy at times can also reduce visibility, especially near
thunderstorms.

Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible hazardous
conditions by remaining in port, seeking safe harbor, altering
course, and/or securing the vessel for severe wind and seas.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates. You may also
follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website at
www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: A Gale Warning remains in effect for American Samoa coastal waters
